hook.text: Two hormones orchestrate the female reproductive cycle with the precision of a symphony conductor.

buildup.text: Estrogen promotes egg development and thickens the uterine lining in the first half of the cycle.

discovery.text: Progesterone stabilizes the lining after ovulation, creating a safe environment for implantation.

twist.text: When both hormones drop sharply, the uterine lining breaks down and menstruation begins.

climax.text: Together they control fertility, bone density, mood, and cardiovascular health in women.

punchline.text: Two hormones, one cycle, countless effects.

quiz.question: What role does progesterone play after ovulation?
